document_data.name: The Weeping War
document_data.result: Victory for the [[Army of Darkness]], loss of [[Myth Drannor]]
document_data.casualties2: All but 200 elves and humans, including [[Dathlue Mistwinter]], [[Fflar Starbrow Melruth|Fflar]], [[Sons of Light]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''Weeping War''' was a fierce conflict that culminated on 15 Flamerule, [[714 DR]], in which the [[Akh'Velahr]] (the army of [[Cormanthor]]) were defeated by the invading demonic forces of the [[Army of Darkness]]. Defeat led to the fall of the predominantly elven city of [[Myth Drannor]], at the time the greatest and most powerful bastion of civilization and a beacon of interracial harmony.

Origins.Helmgrove: Word of this large army reached Captain [[Fflar Starbrow Melruth | Fflar]] of Myth Drannor, who set a watchpost north of the city at [[Helmgrove]], appointing the company named the [[Shield of Myth Drannor]] to it. The entire company was destroyed by the demonic forces.
Origins.Burnt Ridge: A second pre-battle stand was made at [[Burnt Ridge]], where hundreds of the defending [[wizard]]s were killed.
Origins.Evacuation: Fflar set about evacuating the city of all non-combatants, but this began too late and the evacuation continued even as the battle began.
Origins.Siege of Shadow:
<!-- The above header is directly linked from other pages. Please bear this in mind when removing or renaming it. -->
The siege of Myth Drannor by the Army of Darkness was named the Siege of Shadow and began on 21 Kythorn, [[714 DR]]. The forward army and the best wizards have been defeated by this point, and only three thousand defenders remain.

Battle.Banes' Duel:
<!-- The above header is directly linked from other pages. Please bear this in mind when removing or renaming it. -->
At the climax of the battle, [[Aulmpiter]] called [[Fflar Starbrow Melruth|Fflar]] forward and the two engaged in one-on-one combat that became known as the Banes' Duel. Both Fflar and Aulmpiter were slain when a magical blast engulfed them. Their bodies were never recovered,

document_data.Aftermath: Only two hundred elves and allies out of the 3000 who remained behind to defend the city escaped.
